intro: Ecbolium pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered ecbolium, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants, and is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
